solution_line_template: $1 is equivalent to 100 cents so ${total_dollars} is equivalent to {dollars_per_cent}*{total_dollars} = <<{total_dollars}*{dollars_per_cent}={total_cents}>>{total_cents} cents
He bought {num_oranges} oranges for {total_cents} cents so each orange cost {total_cents}/{num_oranges} = <<{total_cents}/{num_oranges}={cost_per_orange}>>{cost_per_orange} cents each

If he sells each orange for {sell_price_per_orange} cents, he is making a profit of {sell_price_per_orange}-{cost_per_orange} = <<{sell_price_per_orange}-{cost_per_orange}={profit_per_orange}>>{profit_per_orange} cents on each one.
